args: The prince and his friends are searching\nfor Ku Hai's fellow student, Haoran.
Sorry, Ku Hai. We struck out again.
Worry not. We have found several useful\nleads—that's more than enough.
Besides, he may no longer be alive.
And if that is the case, I will never find out\nwhat drove him to murder our master.
Hey, Ku Hai! I got some news about\nthat Haoran cat ya been lookin' for.
Nah, but I DID hear a juicy rumor.
Apparently there's a thug out there\nwhat's also lookin' for Haoran.
Why would a thug be looking for him?
No idea. But we might learn somethin'\nif we go chat him up.
What should we do, Ku Hai?
Can you take me to him?
There. That's the guy lookin' for Haoran.
All right. I'll speak to him alone\nso we don't put him on guard.
We'll stay back and keep an eye on things.\nIf it gets dangerous, we'll step in.
Ho, friend. I hear you are searching\nfor a man named Haoran?
I am also searching for him, and wondered\nif you might share what you know.
Bwa ha ha! Looks like he put another\nchump outta work.
Out of work? What do you mean?
C'mon, you know what I'm talking about.\nThe scam that Xuan guy was running!
Don't tell me you don't know about that!
He'd gather up tough guys like me\nand get us to lead fiends to towns.
Soon as everybody panicked,\nhe'd rush in to save the day.
Guy takes out a buncha fiends after leading\nthem there in the first place? If that ain't\na scam, I don't know what is.
Guy paid well, too. REEEAL well.\nBut then that idiot Haoran offed him\nand our gold mine collapsed.
So now I'm penniless and outta work,\nand I'm gonna make Haoran pay!
The hell you on about, buddy?!
Master Xuan was an honorable man!\nHe would never expose people to danger\nsimply to increase his own standing!

You're either a fool or an idiot, buddy,
because Xuan was the most corrupt
guy I ever came across—and I don't
exactly run with packs of choirboys!
He used to go on and on about how much\nhe loved the way people thought he was\nsome super great guy.
Hell, apparently he had a student who\nworshiped him like some kinda hero.\nMan, we used to laugh about that! Ha!
Hang on a sec. You REALLY didn't know\nany of this? Like, not ANYTHING?

Probably shoulda kept my trap shut.
But since I can't have some nobody
spreading this around, I guess I gotta
take care of you. Sorry, buddy!
You got friends?! Man, I got no idea\nwhat's going on here, but I am GONE!
Hold it right there, pal! We got another\nquestion or ten to ask ya.
Oh, for the love of... How many of you\npeople ARE there?!
Let's get back to the castle.\nYou need to rest.
I hear you confirmed that thug's\nstory to be the truth?
I'm sorry, but...Ranzal looked into it,\nand he says it all checks out.
...Do you remember my telling you how\nMaster Xuan saved me from fiends\nwhen I was in the forest?
I now know that, too, was a sham.
Yet I spent years of my life looking up\nto him for it! ...Pathetic.
The justice I believed in at the dojo was\na complete lie. What am I supposed to\nbelieve in now?
It's true that the man you believed in\nturned out to be a fraud.
But that doesn't change how many\npeople you've saved through the\nactions he inspired you to do.
So don't lose sight of what you've been\nfighting for this entire time.
The justice I believed in may have been\nfalse, but the will it inspired is genuine.
I swing my sword for others—and if I\nwere to stop over something like this,\nit would make me truly pathetic.
I apologize for making you worry.\nMy time of hesitation is over—\nI will continue on as I always have.
In the meantime, I would ask you anew\nto help me search for Haoran.
No matter what reason he gives,\nI will not change my way of life\nor stop trying to help others...
But I MUST know the truth of\nhis actions on that day.
